intro: Acronychia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to northern Australia, particularly Queensland, and is characterized by its rough, peeling bark and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
